acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96 hours LC50=0.16ppm of the fish (Rainbow Trout) (AQUIRE, 2003).

acute_toxicity_dermal.hazard_statement: May be harmful in contact with skin
acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of 2,260mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1990)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (inhalation route) value of 7.29mg/L (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1990)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a solid according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 550mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1990)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: There was no treatment-related increase in tumor incidence observed in 2-year (rats) and 18-month (mice) carcinogenicity studies, reported in Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1990).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity is Category 1 and bio-accumulation is low (log Kow=1.4(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), since there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 4%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), it was classified into Category 1.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances with melting point of >55degC are not available (melting point: 104-105degC, Agricultural Chemical Registration Data).

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#2588 Pesticide, solid, toxic, n.o.s. (ICSC (2000))) (UN Recommendation on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative data on in vitro reverse mutagenicity tests, in vitro chromosome aberration tests and in vivo micronucleus tests on mouse bone marrow cells(Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1990)).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine or chlorine

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#2588 Pesticide, solid, toxic, n.o.s. (ICSC (2000))) (UN Recommendation on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on the evidence of increased incidence of postimplantation loss at doses causing an increase in body weight in parental animals observed in rabbit teratogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1990)). Since it cannot be concluded that the findings are secondary to parental toxicity, the substance is classified into Category 2.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#2588 Pesticide, solid, toxic, n.o.s. (ICSC (2000))) (UN Recommendation on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of very mild irritation (the highest mean Draize score of 0.6 by 72 hours), with effects fully resolving by 72 hours, observed in rabbit eye irritation studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1990)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on no evidence of skin irritation observed in rabbit skin irritation studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1990)).

skin_sensitizer.rationale: Based on no evidence of skin sensitization observed in guinea pig skin sensitization tests using the Maximization method (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1990)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At). The substance decomposes in water or dilute acid, according to Merck (13th, 2001)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (liver)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: In rat repeated dose toxicity studies, evidence of fatty degeneration of hepatocytes associated with increased liver weight was found (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1990)). These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: In rat single dose toxicity studies, clinical signs and symptoms including hyperventilation, lacrimation, salivation, reduced locomotor activity, and crouching position were reported (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1990)). These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.
